Title: Few lesser known tricks, quirks and features of C
Description:
There are some tricks, quirks and features (some quite fundamental to the language!)
which seems to throw even experienced developers off the track. Thus I did a sloppy
job of gathering some of them in this post (in no particular order) with even sloppier
short explanations and/or examples (or quote of thereof).

Title: JetBrains Releases Rider 2023.1 EAP 4
Description: JetBrains released Rider 2023.1 EAP 4 on February 12. The latest Early Access Program for Rider contains such features as the ability to debug startup code for WASM .NET applications, support for  Astro tool, full IDE zoom, a feature related to importing Angular templates, and support for TypeScript in Vue template expressions.

Title: How (And Why?) To Wrap External Libraries? - CodeJourney.net
Description: How to wrap external libraries (like npm or Nuget)? How can wrapping save you and your team dozens of working hours?

Title: 346: Calling .NET Libraries from Rust with Native AOT
Description: Native AOT can be used for more than just making super fast apps... you can compile your libraries down to C and use them anywhere!

Title: Early Access Program (EAP) - ReSharper
Description: Productivity and code refactoring plugin for Visual Studio 2019, 2017, 2015, 2013, 2012, and 2010. Supports C#, XAML, ASP.NET, ASP.NET MVC, JavaScript, TypeScript, VB.NET, and build scripts.

Title: ASP.NET Core Razor Pages vs MVC: Which Framework is Best for Web Development in 2023
Description: Discover the pros and cons of ASP.NET Core Razor Pages and MVC. Learn which framework is better suited for simple and complex web applications.

Title: .NET MAUI Challenge 4: Telerik DataGrid
Description: In our fourth .NET MAUI Challenge, we’ll look at the Data Grid from Telerik.

Title: How to create a video and audio recorder in React - LogRocket Blog
Description: Learn how to build a custom audio and video recorder in React using the native HTML MediaRecorder API and MediaStream API.

Title: Pair Programming and test-driven development with Visual Studio Live Share and GitHub Copilot
Description: Pair programming is a software development technique in which two developers work together on the same code at the same time, with one typing and the other reviewing and offering suggestions.
